value.name: 31 party-ready dip recipes for game day
value.description: Our best dip recipes for parties include classics such as spinach-artichoke dip and caramelized onion dip, as well as riffs like jalapeno popper dip.

value.name: House Republicans move closer to rare move of impeaching DHS Secretary Mayorkas
value.description: House Republicans will hold a markup of their impeachment articles against Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas on Tuesday, moving closer to taking the rare step of impeaching a Cabinet official.

value.name: DUP Green Lights Return To Power Sharing In Northern Ireland
value.description: The Democratic Unionist Party has agreed to return to power sharing in Northern Ireland after a post-Brexit boycott lasting nearly two years.

value.name: Labour’s £28bn green pledge set to be consigned to the dustbin of history
value.description: Labour’s famous or notorious £28bn – its promise to spend £28bn a year on climate-friendly investment – is set to be consigned to the dustbin of history, probably within days. The policies underlying that original £28bn pledge – to convert all power generation in the UK to…

value.name: Britain's 'most capable PM'? Starmer opens up record 13-point lead over Sunak in new Ipsos poll
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer has opened up a record 13-point lead over Rishi Sunak in terms of who Britons think is the “most capable Prime Minister ”, according to a new poll.

value.name: The bizarre details in billionaire pub baron Justin Hemmes' wild 40 hour party for 5000 Merivale staff as he throws '90s themed rave in Sydney
value.description: Justin Hemmes treats his Merivale staff to the wildest party of the year every January and he spared ... Justin meanwhile went for a hippy theme in an orange shirt and green striped animal print vest along with marijuana themed green corduroy trousers.

value.name: Unison wants Norwich council to bring services back 'in-house'
value.description: A union has urged a council to bring street cleaning and maintenance work back "in-house". Unison says Norwich City Council contracts out housing maintenance, street sweeping and council office cleaning services to Norwich City Services - a council-owned company.

value.name: Ban NDAs in cases of sexual misconduct, MPs say
value.description: Whistleblowers tell of their experiences within music industry as Commons committee warns perpetrators are being ‘protected by the system’

value.name: John Daly: Remember who created the mess of devolution in Scotland
value.description: THESE days there is a bit of a spring in the step among some of our more excitable Labour colleagues at the City Chambers and it has nothing to

value.name: 70% of housebuilders want Labour to win General Election, says Knight Frank
value.description: The Knight Frank Land Index & Housebuilder Survey of English housebuilders shows 70% favour Labour government plans for reform.

value.name: Redhill's battle against illegal parking as culprits slammed as 'anti-social'
value.description: People have been left frustrated as drivers park on double yellow lines and in pedestrianised zones in the town centre

value.name: Sir Jonathon Porritt and Malvern Hills Green Party team up for talk
value.description: A renowned environmentalist is set to hold a talk in collaboration with Malvern Hill Green Party. Sir Jonathon Porritt, also in partnership with Transition Malvern Hills, Hanleys' and Castlemorton Environmental Groups, and PACE, will present the talk titled 'Why what we eat matters'.

value.name: Questions to be answered after unfinished city block goes up in flames
value.description: The Fox Street Village development has a difficult history - now questions are being asked about what could have been done to prevent Saturday's shocking blaze

value.name: Four Croydon Council libraries could close under new proposals
value.description: Four of Croydon’s libraries could close according to new proposals put forward by the council. The council states the closure is based on the poor post-Covid slump in visitation as well as the overall costs of running all 13 centres in the borough.

value.name: London oil firm's Shetland acquisition shows appeal of area
value.description: Oil firm's decision to back plans to develop huge Shetland field highlights investor interest in area amid Rosebank controversy

value.name: Labour's green energy plans will run out of steam
value.description: In a recent article in the Press (January 24) York Central MP Rachael Maskell described the Labour Party’s Future Energy Plan. It is claimed that a ‘green energy sprint’ will result in the UK, in 2030, being the first country to run on 100 per cent ...

value.name: Housebuilders back Labour to get Britain building
value.description: Housebuilders have indicated that they would prefer a Labour government is formed after the next General Election.

value.name: Croydon's ‘failing’ library service could see four locations close
value.description: Four of Croydon’s libraries could close according to new proposals put forward by the council. The council states the closure is based on the poor post-Covid slump in visitation as well as the overall costs of running all 13 centres in the borough.

value.name: Economic picture ‘different’ to when Labour made £28bn green pledge – Reeves
value.description: Shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves said the economic picture is “very different” to when Labour set out its green investment plan as she refused to repeat her party’s £28 billion spending commitment.

value.name: Rishi Sunak’s net zero targets are ‘path to ruin’, says leading Tory MP
value.description: Rishi Sunak is putting Britain on a “path to ruin” with his pursuit of net zero targets, the leader of an influential Tory group has warned. Craig Mackinlay accused the Prime Minister of overseeing a “shameful acceptance of decline” in the name of the green agenda.
